intro: Acronia alopex, commonly known as the narrowleaf acronia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Acronia alopex is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
